comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: I smell a scam casino a few miles away in the air with this Shiller above posting nonsense about this casino. The casino offers 0.1ETH as the minimum reward when you spin the wheel while you need to connect your wallet so that you can play.Their URL is not match with the casino name that show ho unprofessional this casino. Stay away here and don't be gullible to try connecting your wallet on this casino.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Here we go again, same scam that was announced yesterday from a newbie account. Make sure you do your own research here guys before deciding to try the site out.

comments.body: Heard about this roulette the other day. Indeed, money is withdrawn without restrictions. You can play calmly. My friends have already made a fortune!

comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on August 19, 2023, 02:39:26 PMHere we go again, same scam that was announced yesterday from a newbie account. Make sure you do your own research here guys before deciding to try the site out. Brother, everyone plays in the casino at their own peril and risk. Withdrawal is also available without a deposit, which is great. I hope this is not money laundering.

comments.author: Postalgia
comments.body: I felt unwell all day, had a headache and a fever. Now I saw this roulette, read the reviews, at first I did not believe it. I went to the site, got a free spin. OH YES THIS IS A VICTORY! NOW I FEEL WELL! THANK YOU FOR THAT!

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: There‚Äôs no need to shill a scam project, this is Bitcointalk forum and we know how to spot a scam one and usually a thread with the same comments from newbie accounts are an obvious type of fake hype in the site. Be careful on trying any new site because some are not worth it to try, if this site is legit then you should start looking for real reviews but so far, there is none.

comments.author: OldCat
comments.body: The site is quite legit, a bunch of dissatisfied old farts who were not paid for advertising in the topic, no one needs your services and reviews.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: OldCat on August 19, 2023, 06:57:46 PMThe site is quite legit, a bunch of dissatisfied old farts who were not paid for advertising in the topic, no one needs your services and reviews.If a site is legit then that site does marketing in a efficient way not by hiring the users who post positive one liner reviews about it to shit the thread. I don't know about the site, but if you really think that the site is legit and you're trying to promote a legit service then do it in a natural way like other genuine sites are doing. I don't think anyone was dissatisfied because of not getting paid for this topic, but most of the users have found your way as a scammer's way. The scammers mostly control many new accounts and when they post their threads then they use those accounts to bump the thread in a way like you did. If you think you and the site you're trying to promote is legit and genuine then go with the normal marketing route by launching a signature campaign or something similar to get positive exposure.The ones who have said that your site is a scam are some of the most reputable members of this forum, and I must say that they have spent a lot of time on the forum and can someone something fishy easily. I still say that if you think that your site is legit then go with the traditional way for promoting on this forum. If you're not familiar with this forum's marketing then you should look at others that which ways they are using for marketing of their sites. I must say that your marketing way is very suspicious and anyone who has been on this forum would most probably consider it as a scam.

If you trust the site that much and you don't need any review from any one you can take it down here maybe take it to your person channel, maybe family group where you will be in charge and then every one can use the site because it was advertise by you.
